learning_outcomes.description: demonstrate an understanding of the concept of cultural heritage
discuss new directions in cultural heritage management
demonstrate an understanding of the basic steps required in planning for cultural heritage management
demonstrate an understanding of the basic steps in preparing heritage management plans and impact statements for cultural heritage places
Develop team building and teamwork skills during Group Work activities

assessments.task_description:
You are required to critically reflect on your visit to Cultural Heritage Places visited on the fieldtrip. Following the fieldtrip, you will write a structured reflection and submit your work before the advised due date and time.

The field trip is compulsory and costs approximately $30 per student. It is crictical that students attend the fieldtrip for the best outcome of your assessment. The fieldtrip details will be announced during the semester. Please refer to the Blackboard announcement for the actual cost of the excursion, meeting location, date and time. You will need to organise your own transport to the meeting location at the Museum of Brisbane.

Students who miss the field trip will be offered an alternative option to visit the museum independently to still submit the assessment by the due date. The disadvantage is that you will not receive the guided tour experience organised by the Museum. The Course Coordinator will provide the necessary information for students to complete a self‑guided tour and identify the sites they need to visit. You may only be eligible for alternative arrangement if exceptional circumstances arise that prevent you from attending the fieldtrip. Please contact your course coordinator with supporting documentation of the exceptional circumstances that prevented you from attending for consideration of an alternate arrangement.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
You will form groups of 4 to 5 students to create a heritage impact assessment report for a proposed development in Brisbane. In addition, you will be asked to assess the contribution made by your fellow group members to the assessment task using a peer assessment tool. Those students who do not make a satisfactory contribution to the work may be marked down. Further details of this assessment will be made available on Blackboard.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
In addition to the Heritage Impact Assessment Report, your group will give a 10 minute PowerPoint in-person summarising the findings of your assessment. Your group will be scheduled to have an in-class presentation with the Course Coordinator between 12.00 pm and 15.00 pm

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Your group will be scheduled to have an in-class presentation with the Course Coordinator between 12.00 pm and 15.00 pm
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
The exam will cover lectures from weeks 1 - 11 and will consist of both MCQs and short answer questions.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
